Patrons of Kannauj

The Gahadavala dynasty rose to prominence in the late 11th century, ruling over the Gangetic plains and the ancient city of Kannauj. Chandradeva was the founder of this dynasty, who restored stability in a period of anarchy in North India. They were staunch patrons of Sun worship and made Varanasi their second capital.

тЪФя╕П
Govindachandra: The Greatest Ruler

Govindachandra (1114тАУ1155 CE) was the most powerful king of this dynasty. He successfully defended his kingdom from Ghaznavid invasions and maintained diplomatic relations with the Pala, Sena, and Kalachuri kings. Numerous copper plate inscriptions of his have been found, indicating a prosperous and well-organized administration.

ЁЯУЙ
Jaichand and Decline

The last prominent ruler, Jaichand, is known in folklore for his rivalry with Prithviraj Chauhan. His defeat and death at the hands of Muhammad Ghori in the Battle of Chandawar in 1194 CE fully opened the doors for Turkic rule in North India.
